Projects
Research, UX, Prototype

Search for Rhapsody Music

I was tasked with exploring strategy for an improved Search experience that would be implemented as part of a re-launch of Rhapsody’s product under the Napster brand. My process involved looking at the history of Search interfaces, benchmarking UIs across the music streaming services landscape, and building an understanding around how a search can be much more than just typing into a box. The book Search Patterns: Design for Discovery was particularly inspiring during this project.

Read about the concept and how I arrived at it here.
